content: Besides receiving monthly payouts in your retirement, you can also make withdrawals of your CPF savings from 55, for both planned and unplanned, or emergency expenses.The amount you can withdraw depends on your birth year and the age you are making the withdrawal. You do not need to withdraw everything; you can withdraw only what you need, when you need it and as often as you need to because with PayNow, you can receive your CPF savings almost instantaneously.

metadata.header:
Withdrawing for immediate needs

Make a withdrawal

BACKGROUND
metadata.content: Besides receiving monthly payouts in your retirement, you can also make withdrawals of your CPF savings from 55, for both planned and unplanned, or emergency expenses.The amount you can withdraw depends on your birth year and the age you are making the withdrawal. You do not need to withdraw everything; you can withdraw only what you need, when you need it and as often as you need to because with PayNow, you can receive your CPF savings almost instantaneously.

content: To supplement your monthly payouts, you have the option of making ad hoc withdrawals from your rainy-day funds. These withdrawals offer you flexibility, allowing you to access extra funds whenever necessary. You can choose to withdraw as often as you like, either in full or partial amounts, giving you control over your finances.

metadata.header:

Make a withdrawal

Benefit
metadata.content: To supplement your monthly payouts, you have the option of making ad hoc withdrawals from your rainy-day funds. These withdrawals offer you flexibility, allowing you to access extra funds whenever necessary. You can choose to withdraw as often as you like, either in full or partial amounts, giving you control over your finances.

content: You can withdraw anytime from 55. The amount you can withdraw depends on your birth year and the age you are making the withdrawal.

metadata.header:
Withdrawing for immediate needs

Understand withdrawal options from 55

Unconditional withdrawals
metadata.content: You can withdraw anytime from 55. The amount you can withdraw depends on your birth year and the age you are making the withdrawal.

content: If you have met the FRS, you can withdraw any amount above it. Do consider making that withdrawal in your retirement years.

metadata.header:
Withdrawing for immediate needs

Understand withdrawal options from 55

For members who have met the Full Retirement Sum (FRS)
metadata.content: If you have met the FRS, you can withdraw any amount above it. Do consider making that withdrawal in your retirement years.

content: If you own a property in Singapore, with a lease that lasts you up to at least age 95, you can set aside your FRS with a mixture of property (up to half of your FRS) and cash, and withdraw part of your Retirement Account savings.

metadata.header:
Withdrawing for immediate needs

Understand withdrawal options from 55

For property owners
metadata.content: If you own a property in Singapore, with a lease that lasts you up to at least age 95, you can set aside your FRS with a mixture of property (up to half of your FRS) and cash, and withdraw part of your Retirement Account savings.

content: Consider your retirement needs and lifestyle. Making withdrawals from your CPF savings means reduced monthly payouts in the future. Alternatively, your withdrawable savings can be converted to boost your monthly payouts.

metadata.header:
Withdrawing for immediate needs

Understand the trade-offs when making retirement withdrawals

Balance withdrawals with payouts
metadata.content: Consider your retirement needs and lifestyle. Making withdrawals from your CPF savings means reduced monthly payouts in the future. Alternatively, your withdrawable savings can be converted to boost your monthly payouts.

content: CPF offers risk-free interest rates for your savings. If you don’t need immediate access to funds, leave your savings in your CPF account to earn risk-free interest rates* of up to 6% per annum. Withdraw funds only when you need them. With PayNow, you can receive them almost instantly.

metadata.header:
Withdrawing for immediate needs

Understand the trade-offs when making retirement withdrawals

Take advantage of our risk-free interest rates
metadata.content: CPF offers risk-free interest rates for your savings. If you don’t need immediate access to funds, leave your savings in your CPF account to earn risk-free interest rates* of up to 6% per annum. Withdraw funds only when you need them. With PayNow, you can receive them almost instantly.

content: Consider enhancing your payouts under the Retirement Sum Topping-Up Scheme.

How can you apply after identifying your immediate cash needs?

metadata.content: Consider enhancing your payouts under the Retirement Sum Topping-Up Scheme.

content: You can withdraw from Singpass

How can you apply after identifying your immediate cash needs?

Want to withdraw your CPF savings?
metadata.content: You can withdraw from Singpass

content: There is no limit to the number of withdrawals you can make, as long as you are eligible and have withdrawable savings. You can view your Retirement dashboard to check your eligibility and the amount you can withdraw.

metadata.header:
Withdrawing for immediate needs

How often can I withdraw from my CPF savings?
metadata.content: There is no limit to the number of withdrawals you can make, as long as you are eligible and have withdrawable savings. You can view your Retirement dashboard to check your eligibility and the amount you can withdraw.

content: Yes, you can still withdraw some of your CPF savings even if you have not set aside your Full Retirement Sum. If you are born in 1957 or after, you can withdraw additional amount from your Retirement Account from 65. Check how much CPF savings you can withdraw.

metadata.header:
Withdrawing for immediate needs

Can I still withdraw my CPF savings if I do not have the Full Retirement Sum?
metadata.content: Yes, you can still withdraw some of your CPF savings even if you have not set aside your Full Retirement Sum. If you are born in 1957 or after, you can withdraw additional amount from your Retirement Account from 65. Check how much CPF savings you can withdraw.

content: No, CPF savings withdrawn are not taxable. However, please note that if you have any unpaid taxes or MediShield Life premiums, we may recover the unpaid amount from the CPF savings you are withdrawing. This is done to ensure that everyone fulfils their tax obligations and has sufficient coverage under MediShield Life.

metadata.header:
Withdrawing for immediate needs

Do I need to pay taxes for the amount I withdraw from my CPF accounts?
metadata.content: No, CPF savings withdrawn are not taxable. However, please note that if you have any unpaid taxes or MediShield Life premiums, we may recover the unpaid amount from the CPF savings you are withdrawing. This is done to ensure that everyone fulfils their tax obligations and has sufficient coverage under MediShield Life.

content: If you have a reduced life expectancy due to a medical condition, as certified by an accredited doctor, you may apply to withdraw some of your CPF savings. Severe medical conditions that cause you to be permanently unfit for work or to lack mental capacity permanently can also be considered.

metadata.header:
Withdrawing on reduced life expectancy

RETIREMENT WITHDRAWALS

RETIREMENT WITHDRAWALS
metadata.content: If you have a reduced life expectancy due to a medical condition, as certified by an accredited doctor, you may apply to withdraw some of your CPF savings. Severe medical conditions that cause you to be permanently unfit for work or to lack mental capacity permanently can also be considered.

content: You may withdraw your CPF savings if you meet any of the following conditions as certified by an accredited doctor. 1) Reduced life expectancy due to illnesses 2) Permanently unfit for work 3) Lack mental capacity permanently as defined in the Mental Capacity Act.

metadata.header:
Withdrawing on reduced life expectancy

When you are eligible to withdraw

ELIGIBILITY
metadata.content: You may withdraw your CPF savings if you meet any of the following conditions as certified by an accredited doctor. 1) Reduced life expectancy due to illnesses 2) Permanently unfit for work 3) Lack mental capacity permanently as defined in the Mental Capacity Act.

content: Get an accredited doctor (from public hospitals, polyclinics or a specialist) to complete a medical certification form. If the doctor who has certified your medical condition is not from public hospitals, polyclinics, or is not a specialist, we will require an independent assessment from our panel of doctors.

metadata.header:
Withdrawing on reduced life expectancy

How to get doctor’s certification

CERTIFICATION
metadata.content: Get an accredited doctor (from public hospitals, polyclinics or a specialist) to complete a medical certification form. If the doctor who has certified your medical condition is not from public hospitals, polyclinics, or is not a specialist, we will require an independent assessment from our panel of doctors.

content: Withdrawable amount. You may withdraw $5,000 (excludes monies received by you under the Retirement Sum Topping-Up Scheme and savings in your MediSave Account), or more.

metadata.header:
Withdrawing on reduced life expectancy

How much you can withdraw

Withdrawable amount
metadata.content: Withdrawable amount. You may withdraw $5,000 (excludes monies received by you under the Retirement Sum Topping-Up Scheme and savings in your MediSave Account), or more.

content: Monthly payouts. You may have to set aside a reduced retirement sum in your Retirement Account from which you will receive monthly payouts for your living expenses.

metadata.header:
Withdrawing on reduced life expectancy

How much you can withdraw

Monthly payouts
metadata.content: Monthly payouts. You may have to set aside a reduced retirement sum in your Retirement Account from which you will receive monthly payouts for your living expenses.

content: Step 1: Mail the completed form. Mail the medical certification form completed by your doctor to: CPF Board, Retirement Withdrawals Department, Robinson Road P.O. Box 3060,Singapore 905060 ,Step 2: Apply for withdrawal Submit your withdrawal application online

metadata.header:
Withdrawing on reduced life expectancy

How to apply for withdrawal

Applying for yourself
metadata.content: Step 1: Mail the completed form. Mail the medical certification form completed by your doctor to: CPF Board, Retirement Withdrawals Department, Robinson Road P.O. Box 3060,Singapore 905060 ,Step 2: Apply for withdrawal Submit your withdrawal application online

content: If you have been appointed as a donee through a Lasting Power of Attorney to take care of a member’s CPF and other financial matters, you can apply to withdraw the savings on the member’s behalf.

metadata.header:
Withdrawing on reduced life expectancy

How to apply for withdrawal

Applying as a donee
metadata.content: If you have been appointed as a donee through a Lasting Power of Attorney to take care of a member’s CPF and other financial matters, you can apply to withdraw the savings on the member’s behalf.

content: If you have been appointed as a deputy via a court order under the Mental Capacity Act, you can apply to withdraw the savings on the member’s behalf. If a donee or deputy has not been appointed and you are the member’s next-of-kin, you may apply to the court to be appointed as a deputy under the Mental Capacity Act. The court order should include these suggested clauses if you wish to be empowered to manage all of the member’s CPF matters.

metadata.header:
Withdrawing on reduced life expectancy

How to apply for withdrawal

Applying as a deputy
metadata.content: If you have been appointed as a deputy via a court order under the Mental Capacity Act, you can apply to withdraw the savings on the member’s behalf. If a donee or deputy has not been appointed and you are the member’s next-of-kin, you may apply to the court to be appointed as a deputy under the Mental Capacity Act. The court order should include these suggested clauses if you wish to be empowered to manage all of the member’s CPF matters.

content: If you are applying for a Mental Capacity Act Order that is generally restricted to the use of monies of $60,000 and below, you can use the simplified application process provided by the Family Justice Court to be appointed as deputy.

metadata.header:
Withdrawing on reduced life expectancy

How to apply for withdrawal

Family Justice Court
metadata.content: If you are applying for a Mental Capacity Act Order that is generally restricted to the use of monies of $60,000 and below, you can use the simplified application process provided by the Family Justice Court to be appointed as deputy.

content: Make an appointment to visit any CPF service centre. Please bring these supporting documents (original copies only) for the appointment: Medical report stating that member lacks mental capacity permanently, Lasting Power of Attorney or Court Order, Trust bank account statement or passbook, Your NRIC

metadata.header:
Withdrawing on reduced life expectancy

How to apply for withdrawal

Visit a CPF service centre
metadata.content: Make an appointment to visit any CPF service centre. Please bring these supporting documents (original copies only) for the appointment: Medical report stating that member lacks mental capacity permanently, Lasting Power of Attorney or Court Order, Trust bank account statement or passbook, Your NRIC

content: No, you will no longer be able to withdraw a lump sum at age 55 and payout eligibility age for your immediate retirement needs as the withdrawal savings are already paid out to you earlier under the Reduced Life Expectancy scheme.

metadata.header:
Withdrawing on reduced life expectancy

If I have withdrawn under the Reduced Life Expectancy scheme, can I still apply to withdraw a lump sum at age 55 and payout eligibility age for my immediate retirement needs?
metadata.content: No, you will no longer be able to withdraw a lump sum at age 55 and payout eligibility age for your immediate retirement needs as the withdrawal savings are already paid out to you earlier under the Reduced Life Expectancy scheme.

content: Yes, the donee appointed by the member under the Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) to make decisions on the member’s CPF matters, can apply to withdraw the member’s CPF savings. To learn more about the LPA, please visit the Office of the Public Guardian's website. You can also find out more about What if my next-of-kin did not make a Lasting Power of Attorney?

metadata.header:
Withdrawing on reduced life expectancy

Can someone make a withdrawal on a member's behalf when the member loses mental capacity permanently?
metadata.content: Yes, the donee appointed by the member under the Lasting Power of Attorney (LPA) to make decisions on the member’s CPF matters, can apply to withdraw the member’s CPF savings. To learn more about the LPA, please visit the Office of the Public Guardian's website. You can also find out more about What if my next-of-kin did not make a Lasting Power of Attorney?
